timeline.stationDesc1: Recruitment successful. Obtain {{type}} and get WEMIX reimbursements in Station.
timeline.stationDesc2: Additional recruitment has started. Check the details regarding the recruitment in Station.
timeline.stationDesc4: The target amount of {{n}} WEMIX has been reached in the additional recruitment.  Recruitment status can be found in Station.
timeline.stationDesc5: Additional recruitment successful. Obtain {{type}} and get WEMIX reimbursements in Station.
timeline.stationDesc6: Additional recruitment failed. WEMIX refunds can be processed in Station.

timeline.trustDesc4: DAO Profit Distribution Ratio (Treasury Reserve Fund : Incinerator Fund) has been changed.
timeline.incineratorDesc2: There is less than 1 WEMIX for Gas Fees left in the System Wallet for DAO operations. Gas Fees can be recharged through a Use Treasury Funds proposal in Governance.
timeline.incineratorDesc3: Buyback {{type}} Distribution Ratio (Burning Fund : Funds redistributed to the Obelisk) has been changed.
timeline.governanceDesc1: A new proposal has been registered in Temperature Check. Proposal details are available in Governance.

timeline.governanceDesc5: A proposal has been passed in Governance Check. Proposal details are available in Governance.
timeline.governanceDesc6: A proposal has been rejected in Governance Check. Proposal details are available in Governance.
timeline.governanceDesc7: A proposal has been made invalid in Governance Check. Proposal details are available in Governance.
timeline.governanceDesc8: A proposal has been passed in Trust Check. Proposal details are available in Governance.
timeline.governanceDesc9: A new proposal has been rejected in Trust Check. Proposal details are available in Governance.

neithProtocol.title: NEITH Protocol
neithProtocol.desc:
The protocol of a DAO is usually a system. The term, DAO, is short for 'Decentralized Autonomous Organization'.
It can also be explained as an open source blockchain protocol, which is managed by a set of rules created by elected group members, that automatically executes certain tasks without an intermediary.
The NEITH Protocol is comprised of 7 important components with which {{type}} DAO functions. Each component has a unique role that makes to DAO work.
In {{type}} DAO, the protocol works with 6 components.

smartContract.title: Smart Contract
smartContract.desc:
The Smart Contract is a protocol to execute a DAO. Each NEITH Protocol component operates with
pre-defined Smart Contracts. Established rules can be modified or changed through Governance.

station.desc1:
The Station carries out tasks to recruit DAO members.
It provides various information (Missions, rewards, methods of operation, etc.) that users must know to participate in a DAO.
station.desc2: Smart Contracts in the Station set the ways in which the recruiting process should be operated. This can be decided on through Governance.

0.text: Upon creation of a DAO, an amount of DAO Tokens equivalent to the amount participated compared to the amount of issued DAO Tokens is distributed.
Recruiting conditions cannot be set for initial recruiting

1.desc: Final Collected Amount: {{amount}} WEMIX / Total Amount of Issued {{type}}: {2} WDR [Date Updated : {{volume}}]

0.text: Minimum recruiting amount and currency unit can be set

1.text: Total issued amount of {{type}} can be set

2.desc: Final Collected Amount: {{amount}} WEMIX / Total Amount of Issued {{type}}: {5} WDR [Date Updated : {{date}}]

treasury.desc1:
The Treasury is the community vault where DAO funds are collected and stored. Influx of funds come from recruiting in the Station and from the result of DAO businesses, and these funds are used as funds for DAO businesses, and for operation costs for the execution of DAO contracts
etc. DAO funds are used through on-chain governance decisions.

0.text: Smart Contracts in the Treasury set the ways in which funds within the Treasury are used and stored. This can be decided on through Governance.
Stored funds may be used as business funds

1.text: Part of the Stored funds may be converted into a specified currency unit, or the amount designated to be Stored

trust.desc1: The Trust is an organization that is delegated the name and authorities of the {{type}}, and becomes the contract object in off-chain environments. Information about execution of the investment is available.

0.text: Smart Contracts in the Trust set the ways in which the influx of profits into the Trust are managed. This can be decided on through Governance.
Trust Wallet addresses can be added, changed, and edited

1.text: Business profit distribution ratio can be set

0.text: Current Profit Distribution Ratio for Each Business

0.desc: Treasury Reserve Fund: {{type}} Purchase Fund (Sent to the Incinerator) = <0>{{strong1}}</0> / Fee Ratio : <1>{{strong2}}</1> [Date Updated : {{date}}]

incinerator.desc1: The Incinerator purchases {{type}} (DAO Tokens) in circulation using DAO profits, and burns part of it in the Incinerator to induce increases in the value of {{type}} (DAO Token).

0.text: Smart Contracts in the Incinerator set the ways in which the influx of purchased {{type}} sent to the Incinerator are managed. This can be decided on through Governance.
{{type}} purchase fund distribution ratio can be set
Current Profit Distribution Ratio for Each Business

0.desc: Governance Rewards (Sent to Obelisk) : Burnt = <0>{{strong1}}</0> [Date Updated : {{date}}]

stakingPool.desc1: The Obelisk is where your {{type}} (WDR) can be staked, and Governance Tokens and g.{{type}} (g.WDR) can be claimed. {{type}} DAO members owning g.{{type}} and participating in proposals will lead to growth of the DAO. Also, part of the {{type}} purchased with DAO rewards are supplied here to become rewards with g.{{type}}.

0.text: Smart Contracts in the Obelisk manage the claiming and supply of {{type}} and g.{{type}}.
Staking: When users stake their {{type}}, the Obelisk pays out g.{{type}} according to the Exchange Ratio

1.text: Unstaking: When users return their g.{{type}}, the Obelisk unstakes {{type}} according to the Exchange Ratio

governance.desc1: This is where governance participants owning g.{{type}} Tokens decide on matters on operations of the {{type}} DAO by raising proposals and voting. Free discussion is possible in 'Discussions', and the processes and results of voting that takes place on-chain in 'Proposals' is executed with smart contracts, as a result supporting transparent DAO operations.

0.text: Smart Contracts in Governance support the execution of various proposals related to DAO operations.

4.desc1: Change Conditions to proceed with proposals

recruitCondition.subDesc: Station is a protocol that recruits members through a stake-based proportional distribution and performs an initial sale of DAO Tokens. Successful recruitment grants access to menus of other protocols.

imgArea.title: Example of How {{type}} (DAO Token) Distribution is Calculated

tooltip.1: Upon successful recruitment and ending of the recruitment period, the participation ratio of the recruitment will be calculated.
tooltip.2: Calculates the total amount of {{type}} that can be obtained by multiplying the total amount of distributed {{type}} to the share participated.
tooltip.3: Converts {{type}} that can be obtained into WEMIX, and calculates the difference between the amount participated and the amount converted to get the reimburse amount.

1.desc: If you have not yet participated
1.title: Participate in Recruitment

list.1: Recruitment of WONDER DAO is carried out through subscription.
list.1-tooltip: In the subscription method, the person wishing to participate uses WEMIX owned by the person who wants to participate to express their intention to participate, and when the recruitment ends, they can acquire Wonder issued by WONDER DAO in proportion to the amount of WEMIX they used.
list.2: WONDER DAO can participate using WEMIX. The WEMIX used for participation will be paid in the corresponding Wonder (DAO Token) after the end of the recruitment.
list.3: After the end of the recruitment, Wonder will be distributed to each participating member in a proportional distribution method according to the amount of WEMIX participating in the final recruitment WEMIX amount.
list.4: If the participating WEMIX quantity is greater than the WEMIX quantity corresponding to the distributed Wonder quantity, the difference will be refunded.

2.desc: If the recruitment ends after participation is completed
2.title: Acquiring Wonder (DAO Token)

list.1: After the end of the recruitment, it will take about 2 hours to calculate the distribution of Wonder.
list.2: Allocated Wonders can be obtained by selecting the ‘Acquire’ button in Station.
list.3: If there is a refund amount, the refund process goes along with the Wonder acquisition process.
list.4: If there is a refund amount, the refund process goes along with the Wonder acquisition process.

3.desc: If you want to participate in WONDER DAO's important decision-making
3.title: Acquire g.Wonder (Governance Token)

list.1: To participate in Governance, you must acquire g.Wonder (Governance Token).
list.1-bold: *If you click the ‘Staking’ button in the Obelisk, you can acquire g.Wonder through the staking of your Wonder.
list.2: Upon staking DAO Tokens, they will be subject to a Lock-up period and cannot be Unstaked for 90 days.
list.2-bold: *If you Stake additionally, the 90-day Lock-up will be reset based on the last Staking date.
list.3: The more g.Wonder you hold, the more influence you have on WONDER DAO's decision-making.

list.1: To participate in WONDER DAO after recruitment ends, you must purchase WONDER in WEMIX.Fi.
list.2: You will automatically join WONDER DAO PAPYRUS Community upon purchasing WONDER tokens.

5.title: Obtain G.WONDER and Participate in Governance

list.1: After claiming WONDER (DAO Token), you must obtain g.WONDER (Governance Tokens) to participate in Governance.
list.1-bold: *Click the "Stake" button in Obelisk to get g.WONDER by Staking WONDER in your balance.
list.2: Upon Staking DAO Tokens, they will be subject to a Lock-up period for 90 days and cannot be Unstaked.
list.2-bold: *If you Stake additionally, the 90-day Lock-up period will be reset based on the last Stake date.
list.3: The g.WONDER you claim represents voting rights to participate in Governance. The more g.WONDER you hold, the more influence you have on WONDER DAO decision-making.

1.title: Purpose of DAO
1.desc: WEMIX's first DAO project, WONDER DAO, joins 40 WONDERS*, the 40 Node Council Partners (NCPs) that make up the axis of the stake-based Proof of Authority (SPoA) consensus algorithm chosen by the WEMIX3.0 mainnet. As the NCP of WONDER DAO WEMIX3.0 mainnet, we want to contribute to the safety and expansion of the mainnet by becoming a growing community with the development of the WEMIX mega ecosystem.
1.link: Curious about the roadmap of WEMIX3.0 operation?

2.title: DAO operation (Governance)
2.desc: WONDER DAO decides all matters related to DAO operation through the On-chain Governance Program. The governance token, g.Wonder, is used as voting rights, and the steps of DAO governance are as follows.

list.1: 1.Temperature Check WONDER DAO Governance goes through the process of checking responses and opinions on the issue before voting on the agenda through free discussion in the form of a bulletin board. It can be accessed through the Discussion menu under Governance in the WONDER DAO service menu.
list.2: 2. Consensus Check If an agenda is judged worthy of voting, any DAO member can vote on the topic on-chain. Voting achieves the primary consensus of DAO members through the ‘consultation’ stage, and registration becomes possible through the ‘resolution’ stage voting.
list.3: 3. Governance Proposal Agenda for which the ‘consultation’ vote has been passed can proceed with on-chain voting in the ‘resolution’ stage. The ‘resolution’ stage generally has higher participation conditions than the ‘consultation’ stage. When an agenda is approved in the ‘resolution’ stage, the contract to which the content applies can be executed, and anyone can execute the contract.

1.title: Wonder (Ticker: WDR)
1.desc: Wonder Token is a utility token that proves membership in the WONDER DAO. Wonder tokens will be distributed through an initial sale at Station.

ul.1: Issued amount: 1,500,010 WDR (based on the date of formation of DAO)
ul.2: Issuance method: Issuance through the subscription method at the station
ul.3: Obtained from: Participating in Station or WEMIX.Fi

2.title: g.Wonder (Ticker: g.WDR)
2.desc: g.Wonder Token is the governance token of WONDER DAO. g.Wonder tokens can be acquired by staking Wonder in the Obelisk, and issued or burned in the Obelisk.

tokenomics.title: Tokenomics
tokenomics.desc: WEMIX mainnet allocates a certain percentage (40%, based on WEMIX3.0 phase 01) of newly minted WEMIX per block to Node Council Partners. WONDER DAO is one of the 40 NCPs on the WEMIX mainnet and will be allocated a PMR equivalent to 1%. It is used only for DAO operation and growth, and its use and conditions are determined through WONDER DAO's Onchain governance and recorded on the smart contract.
tokenomics.desc-2: WEMIX allocated by DAO is transferred to Treasury and Incinerator according to the distribution ratio on the contract.

ul.1: Funds received by the Treasury: used as DAO operating funds
ul.2: Funds received by Incinerator: Buyback Wonder (DAO Token) at WEMIX.Fi, and the Buyback Wonder is used in the following two directions according to the distribution ratio

4.title: WONDER DAO Tokenomics Flow Chart
4.desc: The number shown is the initial setting value, and the distribution ratio can be changed through governance later.

list.2: *The figures shown are the initial settings, and the distribution ratio can be changed through governance later.

5.title: Trust Information
5.desc: WONDER DAO Trust performs the following roles under the name of WONDER DAO.
5.btn: Read more NEITH Protocol & Smart Contract

list.1: This is the place where the name and authority of WONDER DAO are delegated and the subject of business conduct, management and contracts.
list.4-1: 3% of the amount of business revenue is paid to the trust operator as a commission for trust operation.

2.title: Trust Performance
2.1: WONDER DAO's NCP node operation agency
2.2: Practicing voting rights on WEMIX3.0 Governance agenda
2.3: Notice to WONDER DAO about the above performance details
2.4: Acting for other fund execution and other tasks necessary for contracts

title.0: How can I participate in {{type}} DAO?

list.title: Use WEMIX to Participate in Station
list.subTitle: If you have not participated yet

list.desc: {{type}} DAO recruitment will be conducted through stake-based proportional distribution where you can participate in with WEMIX and receive the corresponding amount of {{type}} (DAO Tokens) after the recruitment ends.
The rest of the WEMIX used for participation, excluding the amount corresponding to the {{type}} distribution, will be refunded.
The minimum amount required for participation is 10 WEMIX, and there is no maximum limit.
Additional participation and participation cancellation are only available during the recruitment period.

list.title: Obtain {{type}} (DAO Tokens)
list.subTitle: If recruitment ends after you participate

list.desc: It is expected to take about 24 hours to calculate the distribution of {{type}} after the recruitment is over.
{{type}} will be distributed to each member proportionally based on the amount of WEMIX participated to the total amount of WEMIX participated.
The distributed {{type}} can be obtained by selecting 'Obtain {{type}} & Get WEMIX Reimburse'.
If you are eligible for a reimburse, the reimburse process will take place while you obtain the distributed {{type}}.

list.title: Obtain g.{{type}} (Governance Tokens)
list.subTitle: If you wish to participate in the decision-making of important issues in {{type}} DAO

list.desc: To participate in Governance, you must obtain g.{{type}} (Governance Tokens).
list.strong: In the Obelisk, tap the “Stake” button to get g.{{type}} by Staking the {{type}} in your balance.

list.desc: Upon Staking DAO Tokens, they will be subject to a Lock-up period and cannot be Unstaked for 90 days.
list.strong: If you stake additionally, the 90-day Lock-up period will be reset from the last Staked date and time.

list.desc: The more g.{{type}} you have, the more influence you will have on the decision-making process of {{type}} DAO.

protocol.title: Protocol
protocol.desc: The 6 protocols play a pivotal role in the operation and development of {{type}} DAO.

desc1: Station performs the task of recruiting DAO members. Those who wish to participate can become a member of the DAO by purchasing DAO Tokens ({{type}}, Ticker: {{unit1}}) through Station, expressing their agreement with the purpose and operation of the DAO.
desc2: Smart Contracts in Station governs the recruitment operation which can be decided through Governance Proposals.
Conditions such as recruitment period, recruitment target amount, DAO Token issuance, and participation criteria can be set.

desc1: Treasury is the community vault where DAO assets are stored. It is a smart contract-based protocol, and the use of stored Tokens can only be executed through on-chain governance.
desc2: Smart Contracts in Treasury regulate the use and storage of funds in the Treasury, which can be determined through Governance proposals.
Part of the stored funds can be converted and stored in a specific currency unit on WEMIX 3.0.

desc1: The Obelisk is where DAO membership (the right to participate in Governance) can be acquired. Any {{type}} Token Holders who have the same long-term vision for {{type}} DAO and wish to participate in DAO Governance, can Stake {{type}} in Obelisk and obtain g.{{type}}.
desc2: Smart Contracts in the Obelisk manage how members can obtain g.{{type}} by Staking {{type}}, and the Unstaking of {{type}} through the return of g.{{type}}.

desc1: g.{{type}} holders can propose and vote on matters related to the operation of {{type}} DAO in Governance.

1. Temperature Check
In this step, responses and opinions of DAO members are collected and heard. Posts with significant support from DAO members are registered as on-chain suggestions later on.

2. Consensus Check
This is the first step of On-chain voting for a proposal suggestion, where the consensus on changing the current status quo is decided. Proposals that passed the Consensus Check step proceed to the next step, Governance Check.

3. Governance Check
This is the stage where the final decision to execute a proposal is made. Proposals that have been passed the Governance Check stage are recorded and executed on-chain.
desc2: Smart Contracts in Governance support the execution of various Proposals related to DAO operations and changing the settings that are approved.

desc1: Trust acts as a deputy to execute decisions of DAO Governance on behalf of the DAO.
desc2: The Smart Contracts within the Trust determine how profits are managed and this can be decided through Governance.
It is possible to set the distribution ratio of the revenue.

desc1: Incinerator buybacks and burns {{type}} tokens according to the ratio set in the Smart Contract, then redistributes them to the Obelisk.
desc2: Smart Contracts in Incinerator execute Buyback and Distribution of DAO tokens.
Burning of buyback {{type}} and setting the Obelisk redistribution ratio can be determined through Governance.

token.desc: Get DAO Tokens and Governance Tokens to become a member of {{type}} DAO and participate in the decision-making process.

item.name: {{type}}
item.desc: {{type}} Token is a utility token that can be used to issue Governance Tokens. You can Stake {{type}} to obtain g.{{type}} Tokens.
list: Source of Acquisition : Participate in Station or use the Swap service in WEMIX.Fi

item.name: g.{{type}}
item.desc: g.{{type}} is a Token that gives you the right to participate in On-chain Governance, which decides on all matters of {{type}} DAO operations.
list: Governance Token that is issued or burned in the DAO Obelisk

tokenomics.desc: The WEMIX3.0 mainnet allocates 40% of PMR (Permanent Minting Reward, 1 WEMIX per a block, in the WEMIX3.0 phase 01) to Node Council Partners. {{type}} DAO will receive 0.01 WEMIX per a block as one of the 40 NCPs on the WEMIX3.0 Mainnet. Through the tokenomics of {{type}} DAO, we pursue the vision of a growing community.

introduce.title: About DAOs
introduce.desc: As a Wonder (WEMIX On-chain Network Decentralized Ecosystem Regulator) that has been given WEMIX3.0 mainnet net operation authorities, it will have the same responsibilities and access to rewards as other authority nodes. With the Wonder DAO, we will also take one step further towards complete decentralization with WEMIX3.0's SPoA (Stake-based Proof of Authority) consensus algorithm method.

caution.0: If the participating WEMIX quantity is greater than the WEMIX quantity corresponding to the distributed {{type}} quantity, the difference will be refunded.
caution.1: Additional participation and cancellation of participation are only possible during the recruitment period.

participationProcess.title: Participate
participationProcess.availableWemixError1: To participate, you must have at least 10.5 WEMIX*.
participationProcess.availableWemixError2: For additional participation, you must have at least 1.5 WEMIX*.
participationProcess.availableWemixErrorSub1: *Total recruitment target amount (10 WEMIX) and estimated Gas Fees (0.5 WEMIX)
participationProcess.availableWemixErrorSub2: *Minimum amount for additional participation (1 WEMIX) and estimated Gas Fees (0.5 WEMIX)
participationProcess.bannerText: This community is in charge of the first node among the 40 nodes gathered to participate in the WEMIX3.0 Mainnet Governance.
participationProcess.inputBio: Check your profile information, and enter your bio!
participationProcess.welcomeMessage: Leave a message to say hello to the members of {{type}} DAO!
participationProcess.placeholder1: A maximum of {{num}} characters can be entered.
participationProcess.placeholder2: Enter an integer of {{num}} WEMIX or more.
participationProcess.placeholderType2: I'll do my best to contribute!
participationProcess.placeholderType5: It's an honor to be a part of this!
participationProcess.inputWemix: Enter the amount of WEMIX to participate with!
participationProcess.infoText1: The higher the amount of participation, the more {{type}} you can acquire and the more influence you can have on decision-making for DAO operation.
participationProcess.rankText: <0>If you participate with this much WEMIX you will be in the top {{num}} % of the current total of {{totalNum}} participants.
participationProcess.rankText2: <0>If you participate additionally with {{amount}} WEMIX,</0> you will be in the <1>top {{num}}%</1> of the current total of {{totalNum}} participants.
participationProcess.errorMessage2: Enter an integer of {{num}} WEMIX or more.
participationProcess.errorMessage3: The maximum amount excluding Gas Fees.
participationProcess.errorMessage4: You have exceeded the amount of WEMIX required for participation. Please check your balance.
participationProcess.noteHead: Please check the relevant information before participating!
participationProcess.note1: It will take approximately {{num}} hours to calculate the distribution of {{type}} after the recruitment process has ended.
participationProcess.note2: {{type}} will be distributed proportionally based on the amount of participation compared to the final total of recruited WEMIX.
participationProcess.note3: To obtain the distributed {{type}}, simply tap on the "Obtain {{type}} & Get WEMIX Reimburse" button. If you are entitled to a reimburse, it will be processed at the same time as you receive the distributed {{type}}.
participationProcess.note4: The Station of NEITH Protocol is established by 2 or more Wallet (multi-sig) signatures.
participationProcess.note5: Anyone who wants to participate in a DAO must read and acknowledge the Station guide. The decision to participate through Wallet signature will be considered as agreeing to the default set values.
participationProcess.note6: WEMIX used for participation will be used for DAO operations. Once the WONDER tokens have been distributed, any remaining amount of WEMIX will be refunded.
participationProcess.noteRef1: Gas Fees will incur for transfers from the Wallet. Expected gas fees may vary depending on network traffic conditions.
participationProcess.completeMessage1: Once the DAO has been created, please check the <0>2 following points!</0>
participationProcess.completeMessage2: Once {{type}} DAO has been created, you can participate the {{type}} DAO channel in PAPYRUS.
participationProcess.completeMessage2-1: If you have participated in a DAO, you will automatically be invited to the PAPYRUS channel.
participationProcess.completeMessage3: After the recruitment period ends, DAO Tokens will be allocated according to the participation share, and DAO Token claims and remaining WEMIX refunds are possible through Station.
participationProcess.addComplete2: Participation amount has been added. The additional amount will be displayed by adding it to the participation amount.
participationProcess.cancelDesc1: Would you like to cancel your participation? If you cancel your participation, the participation amount will be reimbursed, and a Gas Fee will be incurred during the reimburse process.
participationProcess.cancelDesc2: The Gas Fee for fund transfer will be paid from your Wallet. Depending on network traffic, the estimated Gas Fee may change.
participationProcess.cancelDesc3: Your amount participated has been refunded. The amount refunded can be viewed in your Wallet.
participationProcess.cancelDesc4: You must purchase additional WEMIX if you do not have enough Gas Fees (WEMIX) to proceed.

trust.title: Trust
trust.desc: Trust acts as a deputy to execute decisions of DAO Governance on behalf of the DAO.

item.1: Accumulated Funds Sent To The Treasury
item.2: Accumulated Funds Sent To The Incinerator
item.tooltip1: Total amount of accumulated rewards sent to Treasury Reserve Fund.
item.tooltip2: Total amount of accumulated rewards sent to Incinerator.
item.tooltip3: Total amount of accumulated rewards used as Trust Fees.

0.title: About
0.desc: The Trust acts as a deputy to execute decisions of DAO on behalf of the DAO. Wemade takes on the role of the Trust of {{type}} DAO, participating as a Node Council Partner(NCP), storing and managing the Trust wallet, and more.

list2.0: Trust is composed of smart contracts that keep a record of tokens sent from the Treasury to the Trust Wallet, and distribute and record tokens sent from the Trust Wallet to the Treasury and Incinerator components.

list2.3: The Trust Wallet is managed transparently with Multi-sig.

caption.0: The wallet connected to NEITH Protocol, responsible for sending and receiving tokens
caption.2: The wallet to create the {{unit1}}-WEMIX pair pool on WEMIX.Fi

list2.0: PMR accumulated from participation of {{type}} DAO in NCP will be transferred to the Trust Contract on the first Tuesday of each month. If Tuesday is a holiday, it will be transferred on Thursday.
Trust takes a 2% fee on PMR transfers. Trust fee is paid by a smart contract and transparently recorded on the blockchain.

tooltip.name: Profit sharing ratio of the business

trust.error: Please enter the amount to use.

treasury.title: Treasury
treasury.desc: Treasury is the community vault where DAO assets are stored. It is a smart contract-based protocol, and the use of stored Tokens can only be executed through on-chain governance.

incinerator.title: Incinerator
incinerator.desc: Incinerator buybacks and burns {{type}} tokens according to the ratio set in the Smart Contract, then redistributes them to the Obelisk.

item.6: Balance of Gas Fee for {{type}} Purchase
item.tooltip2: {{type}} purchases are executed through random algorithms that require Gas Fees. If there are not enough Gas Fees, the Incinerator operation will be halted, so please add Gas Fees to the protocol operating Bot-Wallet through Proposal about funds in Governance.

tooltip.title: Profit sharing ratio of the business

governance.title: Governance
governance.desc: g.{{type}} holders can propose and vote on matters related to {{type}} DAO operations through Governance.

item.5: Change Type of Tokens Stored in Treasury

tab1.desc: Proposals about using the DAO Reserve Fund.
tab1.placeholder1: Select the Token to use to enter amount.
tab1.placeholder2: Up to 18 decimal places can be entered.

tab2.desc: Proposals about setting the distribution ratio for distributing DAO profits such as PMR to the Treasury Reserve Fund and Incinerator Fund.
tab2.error1: Please enter a number between 0 and 100.
tab2.info1: *The ratio for these choices are ratios for 'Treasury Reserve Fund : Incinerator Fund'.
tab2.info2: *Distribution ratio of the amount left after the 2% Trust fees.

tab3.desc: Proposals about setting the distribution ratio for DAO Tokens purchased from the Incinerator.
tab3.error1: Please enter a number between 0 and 100.
tab3.info1: *The ratio for these choices are ratios for "Burn : Obelisk Distribution".

tab4.desc: Proposals about changing the Consensus check and Governance check operation conditions for on-chain votes.
tab4.error1: Please enter a number over 0 and under 100.
tab4.error2: Please enter a number between 1 and 30.

tab5.desc: Proposals to change the type of Token stored in the Treasury.
tab5.placeholder1: Input available when 'Token to pay with' is selected.
tab5.placeholder2: Up to 18 decimal places can be entered
tab5.info1: *The estimated amount to claim is calculated based on current prices.

tab6.desc: Proposals to reopen the Station to raise additional funds and issue additional DAO Tokens.
tab6.th3: Amount of DAO Tokens to Additionally Issue
tab6.placeholder2: Please enter 18 decimal places or less.
tab6.error1: Please enter the amount to use.
tab6.error3: Please enter a number between 1 and 30.
tab6.desc2: *Conducted in the token unit of the initial Station recruitment, and the raised funds will be sent to the Treasury.
tab6.desc3: *Recruitment begins once the proposal is finally approved and the contract is executed.

tab7.desc: Proposals to check changing conditions of urgent proposals that can only be suggested by Trust.
tab7.error1: Please enter a number between 1 and 30.
tab7.error2: Please enter a number of 50 or over.

tab8.desc: Proposals to check Yes/No answers by DAO on various other topics.
tab8.desc1: *Content entered and voting results will be recorded on the blockchain.

agenda.modalDesc: Detailed conditions for this proposal can be entered.

1.title: Consensus Check
1.desc: As a first suggestion step, decide whether you are willing to change the status quo. An agenda approved by a majority vote in the Consensus Check stage can be registered as a Governance Proposal in the next stage.

list.1: Proposal Threshold: N% of GT issuance

2.title: Governance proposal
2.desc: This is the stage where the voting to decide whether to execute the agenda for which the Consensus Check has been completed is in progress. In the Governance Proposal stage, an agenda approved by a majority vote is executed by DAO members or the system.

list.1: Proposal Threshold: N% of GT issuance

3.title: Execution
3.desc: The final approved agenda is applied by contract execution. The contract executor can be any DAO member, and is basically executed by the DAO System.

list.2: DAO Operating Expense Balance: n WEMIX

bottom.title: Easy Governance
bottom.desc: NILE's Governance Program is designed so that even DAO members without programming skills can easily participate by providing the type of agenda and the conditions to be changed in a well-configured UI. Please check <0>{{link}}</0> for details related to Governance operation.

btn.4: Executing the conclusively passed contract of this proposal.

buttonText.consensusCheck: The proposal has been moved to the Consensus Check step. {{text}}
buttonText.governanceCheck: The proposal has been moved to the Governance Check step. {{text}}

cardStatus.majorityInFavor: Immediately passed by a majority approval. {{text}}
cardStatus.majorityInAgainst: Immediately rejected by a majority opposition. {{text}}

action.inputError: The withdrawal amount has exceeded the selected Treasury Fund. Please modify the estimated amount to be used.
action.inputError2: Only min. 1 day to max. 10 days can entered for voting period.
action.inputError3: Min. 0.01% to max. 100% must be entered for the conditions for registration of an proposal.
action.inputError4: Only min. 1% to max. 100% can entered for quorum.

dropdown.3: Change Purchased DAO Token Distribution Ratio
dropdown.5: Change Conditions to Proceed with Proposals
dropdown.6: Additional Recruitment in Station (Additional Issuing of DAO Tokens)
dropdown.7: Add to And Change Trust Wallet Addresses

popover.1:
[Use of Treasury]
Community funding for a particular purpose You can decide whether to use it or not.
popover.2:
[Change DAO Revenue Distribution Ratio]
You can change the share of DAO revenue.
popover.3:
[Change purchase DAO Token distribution ratio]
Earnings allow you to change the share of DAO Token acquired by Incinerator.
popover.4:
[Change the currency of Treasury deposit fund]
You can change the unit of Treasure funds.
popover.5:
[Change Proposal progress conditions]
You can change the registration conditions, quorum criteria, and approval conditions for each type of agenda and each stage of progress.
popover.6:
[Additional Recruitment in Station (Dao Token Additional Issue)]
Additional stations can be recruited for the purpose of issuing additional DAO Token.
popover.7:
[Change/Add Trust Wallet Address]
You can change, add, or delete the Trust wallet address.

infoTitle.5: Treasury Reserve Fund and Incinerator Fund Ratio, Trust Fee Ratio
infoTitle.6: DAO Token Distribution Ratio of Incinerator Purchase
infoTitle.11: Conditions for Registration of an Proposal

infoContent.1: Please choose the name of this business.
infoContent.3: You can add a new business.
infoContent.10: DAO Tokens burnt : Obelisk Governance Rewards
infoContent.11: Treasury balance of the selected currency
infoContent.22: GT Balance compared to GT Issued Amount
infoContent.24: Please choose the currency unit for the additional recruiting.
infoContent.25: Please choose a name of a registered Trust Wallet.
infoContent.31: If more than {{N}}% of vote participants agree
infoContent.32: Enter the name of the business.

bottomDesc.1: *Related fees are taken out of the Treasury funds, and if the Treasury has not enough WEMIX, this proposal will not be executed even if passes.
bottomDesc.2: *The Trust Fee is deducted from the total amount upon on moving of business funds and generation of profit, and moved according to the Incinerator Fund Ratio and Treasury Reserve Fund, set based on the amount after the fees.
bottomDesc.3: *When passed, the funds are exchanged in WEMIX.Fi, then deposited in the Treasury again. Related fees are taken out of the Treasury funds, and if the Treasury has not enough WEMIX, this proposal will not be executed even if passes.

registCheck.title: Confirm Proposal Registration
registCheck.temperature:
Would you like to register this proposal? 
The text can be edited or deleted only during the participation period.
registCheck.consensus:
Would you like to register this proposal? 
The text can be edited or deleted only during the voting period.
registCheck.governance:
Would you like to register this proposal? 
The body text cannot be edited or deleted after the proposal has been registered.

registerStop.title: Quit Proposed Action
registerStop.desc:
Would you like to stop creating this proposal? 
The written content will not be saved.

typeSelect.title: Select Proposal Type
typeSelect.typeDesc1: Proposals requiring prompt processing will undergo a single decision-making step (lasting one day) before being processed.
typeSelect.typeDesc2: Proposals that undergo the standard decision-making process will go through three steps of decision-making.

unableToRegister.title: Proposal Register Unavailable
unableToRegister.desc: Selected condition has not changed from the previous condition. At least one condition must be updated to register for this offer.

cantWrite.title: Unable to propose an agenda
cantWrite.desc:
You must own {{n}}% or more of total issued g.{{ticker}} to register proposals.
<0>(Amount needed to fulfil requirement to register proposals: {{n2}} g.{{shortTicker}})</0>

commentDel.title: Delete Comment
commentDel.desc: Would you like to delete this comment?

commentCantWrite.title: Comment Post Unavailable
commentCantWrite.desc: You must have g.{{type}} Tokens in your balance to post.

commentEditCancel.title: Cancel Edit
commentEditCancel.desc: Would you like to cancel editing?

delProposal.title: Delete Proposal
delProposal.desc: Would you like to delete this proposal?

checkQuantity.title: Participation Amount Information
checkQuantity.desc: You cannot participate because you do not own g.{{ticker}}. You can get g.{{ticker}} by staking {{ticker}} in the Obelisk.

cantFeasible.title: Proposal Execution Unavailable
cantFeasible.desc:
You must own more than {{n}}% of total issued g.{{ticker}} to execute proposal suggestions. 
<0>(Amount required to execute proposal suggestions: {{n2}} g.{{shortTicker}})</0>

cancelVote.title: Confirm Cancellation of Vote
cancelVote.desc:
Would you like to cancel your vote?
All of your votes will be collectively canceled.

cantVoting.title: Vote Unavailable
cantVoting.desc: You cannot vote because you do not own g.{{ticker}}. You can get g.{{ticker}} by staking {{ticker}} in the Obelisk.

editReset.title: Reset Changes
editReset.desc:
Would you like to stop editing? 
If you leave the screen while editing, the changes will not be saved.

limitVoting.title: Vote Restriction Notification
limitVoting.desc: Additional votes of Yes or No can only be cast only in the same way as your original vote.

noticeDel.title: Delete Notice
noticeDel.desc: Would you like to delete this notice?

noticeAdd.title: Confirm Posting of Notice
noticeAdd.desc: Would you like to post this Trust notice?

inputClear.title: Reset to Default
inputClear.desc:
Would you like to stop writing this notice? 
If you leave the screen while writing, the content will not be saved.

governance.tabletWarning: Proposals can only be created on PC.

text.1: <0>{{percentage}}%</0> (2,000 g.WDR) selected Agree; this proposal has been moved to the <1>{{step}}</1> step.
text.2: <0>{{percentage}}%</0> (2,000 g.WDR) selected Yes; this proposal has been moved to the <1>{{step}}</1> step.

checkComment.title: Comments
checkComment.term: Inappropriate comments may lead to disadvantages under the terms of use.

info.desc: In the Temperature Check step, the body text can only be edited during the participation period.

scan.title: {{type}} Scan
scan.desc: {{type}} Scan is an explorer that allows everyone to visualize all transactions in {{type}} DAO.  Check the validated codes transparently in {{type}} Scan.
scan.empty:
The search string you entered is invalid. 
Please try again.

coinConfirm.title: Approve Coin use
coinConfirm.desc: NILE requires approval of authorization for using coins. Coin usage authorization is a one-time requirement.

howItWorksModal.title: How Governance Operates
howItWorksModal.content: {{type}} DAO Governance supports transparent and secure DAO operation through a three-step voting process.

1.title: Temperature Check
1.desc: In this step, the reaction and intentions of DAO are confirmed off chain; and posts that have received support from DAO members will be registered as on-chain proposals later on.

2.title: Consensus Check
2.desc: This is the first on-chain voting step for the suggested proposal, which determine whether there is an intention to change the status quo. Proposals that have been approved during the Consensus Check step can proceed to the next stage, the Governance Check.

3.title: Governance Check
3.desc: This is the step to determine the final execusion of the proposal. Proposals that have been approved during the Governance Check stage will be recorded and executed on-chain.

modal.infoText: Should the community participate in the Protocol Guild Pilot? It is a long established fact that a reader will be distracted by the readable content of a page when looking at its layout.
modal.voteUseInfo: Enter the amount of g.{{type}} to use for voting.
modal.voteGasFeeInfo: Gas Fees will be processed upon voting.
modal.ConsensusCheck: This includes the 500 g.WDR used in Consensus Check.

GovernanceVote.executed:
The proposal has been processed. 
It will now move on to the Consensus Check step.
GovernanceVote.stepMovement: The proposal has been moved to the Consensus Check step.
GovernanceVote.voteCancelToast: Retrieved all Governance Tokens voted on this proposal. ({{type}} g.WDR)
GovernanceVote.nogType: You do not own g.{{type}}. You can get g.{{type}} by staking {{type}} in the Obelisk.
GovernanceVote.governanceVoteInfo: g.WDR used for the Consensus Check vote on the same proposal will be automatically retrieved and included in the available vote count for the Governance Check. If you do not wish to participate in the Governance Check vote, please retrieve it manually from the Consensus Check proposal.
GovernanceVote.voteInfoList1: A <0>{{word}}</0> based on the issuance of Governance Tokens must be reached to proceed to the Consensus Check step.
GovernanceVote.voteInfoList2: By selecting Agree or Disagree, you participate in the decision-making process with the number of Governance Tokens you own. <0>{{word}}</0>
GovernanceVote.voteInfoList2word: Governance Tokens are not used even if you participate.
GovernanceVote.voteInfoList3: A  <0>{{word1}}</0> based on the issuance of Governance Tokens and a majority approval are <1>{{word2}}</1>
GovernanceVote.voteInfoList3word1_2: required to proceed to the Governance Check step
GovernanceVote.voteInfoList4: If a majority support is reached based on the number of issued Governance Tokens at the time of registration, the proposal will be passed immediately. Otherwise, it will be instantly rejected.
GovernanceVote.majorityInFavor:
Immediately passed by a majority approval.
<0>{{word}}</0>
GovernanceVote.immediateRejection:
Immediately rejected by a majority opposition. 
<0>{{word}}</0>
